I should get some,” Eddie offered as an excuse.“No, you stay, I’ll get it.”Before Eddie could insist, he was silenced by the view of Buck standing up from the water, swim trunks dripping wet and plastered to his large, muscular thighs. entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 448,317Chapters: 52/?Kudos: 65

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 296,401Chapters: 47/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: to face unafraid, the plans that we've made
entry.summary:
Author: Minalover

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,324Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 53

Summary: ""Cocoa?" Chris's eyes are bright behind his glasses, even though he's much taller than he was the last time they'd made it to see Santa at The Grove. Eddie and Chris had joined the Buckley-Hans for Robbie’s first Christmas. They hung back while Buck, Maddie, and Chimney wrangled Jee-Yun and the baby (and the 800 shopping bags dangling from Buck’s arms) as they shuffled in line to visit the latest iteration of Mall Santa. Chris had declared himself too old for Santa photos years ago, and Eddie wasn’t going to shell out $30 for something he didn’t even want." or: Blair returns

entry.title: i wish you were a girl, do you?
entry.summary:
Author: forevervalentine

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,038Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 12

Summary: In which Eddie Diaz wishes Buck were a girl, and Buck gives him exactly what he asked for. Sort of. Loosely based on that one scene from As You Are.—-or—-“Even though it was horrible and messy in the end, I can’t help but miss it. The knowing. Not having to step on each other’s toes and waving our hands listlessly around at every decision as if we’re lost in the dark. I’m tired of being unsure. I’m tired of being afraid.”The two sat in silence with those words for a minute. They hung in the air like ash, days after a house fire.“Sometimes, I wish it could be you.” It was almost a whisper, so quiet that Buck wasn’t sure Eddie had even been speaking.“What?”“I wish… no, I don’t mean… I wish it were you. I just wish it could be as easy as it is with you.”He chuckled to himself, as if the next words — the ones that would lead to Buck’s impending doom — were absurd.“Sometimes, I wish you were a girl.”

entry.title: Second Chance
entry.summary:
Author: sweetie_mae

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,220Chapters: 3/10Kudos: 116

Summary: “I got the call today,” he said finally, voice barely above a whisper. “They tested me. I’m a match.”She straightened. “For Christopher?”Buck nodded. “Yeah. They think a transplant could save him.”Silence settled between them, heavy, familiar. She looked away, her eyes fixed on the photo of Daniel on the fridge.“You know what this means, Buck,” she said quietly.“I do,” he murmured. “I just keep thinking about him. About how it didn’t work. I was supposed to save him and I wasn’t enough”Maddie’s voice softened. “You were a baby, Buck. You did everything you could. It wasn’t your fault.”He shook his head. “What if it happens again? I-I mean, what if I fail him too?”OrAfter months of subtle, overlooked symptoms, Christopher’s health suddenly collapses. A shocking diagnosis follows, bringing heartbreak, fading hopes, and one final chance: Buck.

entry.title: Oh Christmas tree, how lovely are your - SPIDERS?
entry.summary:
Author: sassay

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,511Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 48

Summary: He lifts the branch holding a clay gingerbread man when something catches his eye in the light - a cobweb strand, definitely a cobweb strand and not a stray thread.“Nope,” Eddie says to himself, “I am not having a spider infestation for Christmas.”Eddie has two options here, he could spray the tree with some bug spray - he even has the type that protects surfaces for up to a week so any spider not in the tree right now would also be killed. Or, he could get rid of the tree. After a few too many calls involving spiders in Christmas trees, Eddie can't sleep worrying about the possible arachnid infestation in the Diaz Christmas tree. So he does the only logical thing - throws it out at midnight. Only...how will he explain the missing tree to Christopher in the morning? Buck to the rescue - he probably deserves an early Christmas present (kiss) for his help really. DAY 1 FILL PROMPT - Christmas Tree

entry.title: Wrapped Up With You
entry.summary:
Author: orionandhisdog

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,412Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 23

Summary: God forbid, if Buck ever had to retire from firefighting, he was sure he could find a career as a professional gift wrapper. These had the cleanest wrapping yet — perfectly creased folds and practically invisible seams. Martha Stewart would be proud. However, she would not be proud of the bows Buck had been trying to make for the last 15 minutes. Even though the wire-edged ribbon would make it easier to shape the bows at the end, that would involve making a good bow to start with, and that was proving to be more difficult than he had predicted.or Buck does some last-minute gift wrapping. It goes about as well as you’d expect.

entry.title: Things We Don't Say
entry.summary:
Author: Ifallinlovewithfictionalboys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 115,750Chapters: 18/23Kudos: 71

Summary: “What are you doing? You have to keep moving.”   “I never told you I’m from LA.”   Dr. Sol’s eyes widen, and he takes a step back.   “Howard–”   “Don’t.” He lets out an animaltic growl, “Don’t say anything unless it’s to explain what the hell is going on and why there is a Korean gang looking for me.”   “Mafia.” Dr. Sol corrects, “I don’t know what they want from you, I just know of them. Now please, you must go back to L.A. Your pack needs you.”  ---After seven months of being presumed dead, Buck comes back and finally reunites with his family.Now that he’s back, Buck makes it his mission to change things along the way. It’s easier than ever now that his pack knows the truth — or so he thought. Apparently, a supernatural world can make a world of a difference, and new threats are coming out of the shadows.It doesn’t help that he feels like he’s constantly forgetting something, or that Chimney is hiding secrets of his own.—PLEASE NOTE: This is part of a series, and will likely not make any sense as a stand alone.
